240.question: What was the performance of both approaches on their dataset?
240.response: {'Answer': 'The i-vector approach achieved a SITW(S) accuracy of 7.30% on the evaluation set and an accuracy of 19.05% on the CN-Celeb(E) dataset. The x-vector approach achieved a SITW(S) accuracy of 4.78% on the evaluation set and an accuracy of 15.52% on the CN-Celeb(E) dataset.'}
240.answer: ERR of 19.05 with i-vectors and 15.52 with x-vectors

242.question: What genres are covered?
242.response: {'Answer': 'The genres covered are  Entertainment, Interview, Singing, Play, Movie, Vlog, Live Broadcast, Speech, Drama, Recitation, Advertisement.'}
242.answer: genre, entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement

244.question: Which of the two speech recognition models works better overall on CN-Celeb?
244.response: {'Answer': 'The i-vector model with the VoxCeleb front-end and VoxCeleb(L) back-end performs best on CN-Celeb with an error rate of 17.43%.'}

245.question: By how much is performance on CN-Celeb inferior to performance on VoxCeleb?
245.response: {'Answer': 'The performance on CN-Celeb is inferior to performance on VoxCeleb by around 7-8 percentage points'}
245.answer: For i-vector system, performances are 11.75% inferior to voxceleb. For x-vector system, performances are 10.74% inferior to voxceleb
